text: they say that many of the teachings of
how we live come from the grizzly bear
the bear dance is a medicine healing
dance a ceremonial dance but also
celebration dance there is no other
dance like it the actions and movements
mimic the movements and gestures that a
grizzly bear would do and so scooping up
my hand harvesting the salmon when I'm
drugging the shoulders
that's like Grizz is walking on the
earth sometimes they're very playful and
they're trying to catch a butterfly or a
bee so they will be jumping up when I'm
wearing the hide I am one with Grizz I
am the bear
so here he is so what's his name
Grizz is the grizzly bear that I dance
with him he's from my community of
Washington the grizzly bear habitat has
been encroached upon Grizz was put down
for the safety of humans and so with
that my community retrieved him and from
there I've been with Grizz so I have
danced with Grizz and ceremony with
Grizz had a sweat lodge with Grizz bask
in the Sun with Grizz do you'll go with
Grizz and that's a part of acknowledging
Grizz is spirit we don't hunt bears and
we don't kill bears if we look after the
grizzly bear then we are also looking
after the sustainability of our culture
I used to power dance and do the whole
powwow circuit thing I took a step back
from that because I began to realize
powers were never a part of bear clan
culture and so I wanted my children to
see that you don't have to do those
dances you can do your own dances so all
my history and all my strength and all
my songs and all my ancestors those are
the memories that keep me going and keep
me moving
